poem.title: For Autumn
poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text:
Still hubs, the trees turn
As September hulls, for instance,
Conkers heaped in pyramids by Huns
And hunter-gardeners. Now one of them
Hugs his petrol chanter,  that
Hums out of tune and hurls leaves at nothing.
What's his is mine.
What's mine is hers.
